meanings.def: a wooden or metal bar placed around something as a barrier or to provide support
examples: She leaned on the ship's rail and gazed out to sea.
She climbed onto the top fence rail.
She held tightly on to the rail.
After the accident a guard rail was placed all the way along the cliff path.
She came slowly down the stairs, holding the banister rail.

meanings.def: a bar fixed to the wall for hanging things on
examples: a picture/curtain/towel rail
There was thick dust on the picture rail.
Lace curtains hung from the brass rails over the bed.
heated towel rails

meanings.def: each of the two metal bars that form the track that trains run on
examples: The train thundered along the rails.
The train came off the rails.
Trams run along rails.
Weeds grew between the rails.
A child was seen crossing the rails.
The gun is mounted on rails.

meanings.def: railways as a means of transport
examples: by rail to travel by rail
rail travel/services/fares
a rail link/network
He uses a combination of commuter rail and subway to get to work.
Many business people now opt for high-speed rail rather than flying.
We went from London to Budapest by rail.
the Channel Tunnel rail link
efforts to modernize the rail network

meanings.def: to become successful again after a period of failure, or to begin functioning normally again
examples: He has helped get the company back on the rails again.

meanings.def: to start behaving in a way that is strange or unacceptable, for example drinking a lot or taking drugs
examples: She went completely off the rails after her sister died.
She was worried her son was going to go completely off the rails.

meanings.def: to lose control and stop functioning correctly
examples: The company has gone badly off the rails in recent years.

idioms.def: to become successful again after a period of failure, or to begin functioning normally again
examples: He has helped get the company back on the rails again.

meanings.def: to complain about something/somebody in a very angry way
examples: She railed against the injustice of it all.
